media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

media_source_tags.description: Media for which url sharing on twitter is aligned with the U.S. partisan center
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Evenly by Followers of Conservative & Liberal Politicians 2019 (US Center 2019)

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Evenly by Republican/Democrat Voters 2018

We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Evenly by Republican/Democrat Voters 2018

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Evenly by Republican/Democrat Voters 2018

They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Somewhat More by Democrat Voters 2018

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Evenly by Republican/Democrat Voters 2018

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Somewhat More by Democrat Voters 2018

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Evenly by Republican/Democrat Voters 2018

media_source_tags.description: LOW Factual Reporting means the source rarely uses credible sources and is simply not trustworthy for reliable information. These are the sources that need to be fact-checked for intentional fake news, conspiracy, and propaganda.
media_source_tags.label: Iffy Collection Low Factual Reporting

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Mostly by Republican Voters 2018

media_source_tags.description: These were sourced from a Robertson 2018 paper (https://cbw.sh/static/pdf/robertson-www18.pdf), which had a pool of around 500,000 Twitter users connected to their voter registration information (Republican or Democrat). They compute a bias score between -1 and 1 based on the relative amount of links shared by those two groups. We filtered those domains for US-based news sites via a number of methods and then a manual review. Then we split into quintiles based on the bias score.
media_source_tags.label: Tweeted Mostly by Democrat Voters 2018
